TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IHttpClientTraceEnricher

Docs.summary: Interface for implementing an enricher for enriching only traces for outgoing HTTP requests.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Enrich (System.Diagnostics.Activity activity, System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage? request, System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage? response);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Enrich(class System.Diagnostics.Activity activity, class System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage request, class System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage response) cil managed
Public Sub Enrich (activity As Activity, request As HttpRequestMessage, response As HttpResponseMessage)
abstract member Enrich : System.Diagnostics.Activity * System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage * System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage -> unit
public: void Enrich(System::Diagnostics::Activity ^ activity, System::Net::Http::HttpRequestMessage ^ request, System::Net::Http::HttpResponseMessage ^ response);

Docs.param: The object to be used to add the required tags to enrich the traces.
The HTTP request object associated with the outgoing request for the trace.
The HTTP response object associated with the outgoing request for the trace.
Docs.summary: Enriches a trace with desired tags.
Docs.remarks: If your enricher fetches some information from or to enrich HTTP traces, make sure to check them for .
